intro: Androcorys kalimpongensis, commonly known as the Kalimpong orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the Himalayan region of India. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), while its flowers are usually pink or purple in color. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
